snippet: An official suggested Israel would use force to prevent the transfer of weapons to Islamic militants, a warning that could be intended not just for President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Senior Israeli official signals that Israel is considering additional military strikes against Syria to prevent transfer of advanced weapons to Islamic militants in region, and that Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad will face crippling consequences if he retaliates.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren and Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: An official suggested Israel would use force to prevent the transfer of weapons to Islamic militants, a warning that could be intended not just for President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Israel Hints of New Strikes Over Weapons and Warns Syria Not to Retaliate
headline.main: Israel Hints at New Strikes, Warning Syria Not to Hit Back
headline.print_headline: Israel Hints at New Strikes in Syria Over Weapons Transfers to Militants

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
